SCANDAL.Definition: a shocking event that made people angry

REBELS.Definition: people who fought against their government or leaders

HOSTAGES.Definition: people kept as prisoners to make others do what the captors wanted

COVERT OPERATIONS.Definition: secret actions, usually done by the military or government

RIGID.Definition: strict and not easy to change

CHECKS AND BALANCES.Definition: rules that make sure no part of government has too much power

WAS NO EXCEPTION.Definition: was not different from others; followed the same rule

SPREAD.Definition: move or grow over a larger area

VIRUS.Definition: a tiny organism that causes disease and spreads easily

GUERRILLA.Definition: engaging in irregular warfare as an independent group

BUFFER.Definition: something that separates or protects one thing from another

TURN OUT.Definition: happen or end in this way

HOSTAGE.Definition: a person kept prisoner to make others do something

INAUGURATION.Definition: the ceremony when he officially became president

STATE SPONSOR.Definition: a country that gave help or money to it

SPONSOR OF.Definition: a country that gave money or help

VOLATILE.Definition: likely to change suddenly; not stable

DRAWN-OUT.Definition: lasting a long time; longer than expected

CHAOS.Definition: complete confusion and lack of order

STATION CHIEF.Definition: the person in charge of the local office

CAPTORS.Definition: people who took and kept them as prisoners

JAILS.Definition: places where the prisoners were kept

NEGOTIATING.Definition: trying to reach an agreement by talking

GO BACK ON.Definition: break his promise or change his mind

THE STAGE WAS SET.Definition: everything was ready for something to happen

SWORN ENEMY.Definition: one who was completely against them

INFLUENCE.Definition: power to change or affect what they did or thought

PROHIBITED.Definition: did not allow; banned by law

ABUSES.Definition: cruel or wrong treatment of people

INTERPRETING.Definition: understanding it in a particular way

DESPICABLE.Definition: very bad and not deserving respect

REPLENISHED.Definition: filled up again after being used

POCKETED.Definition: took or kept it for himself

KIDNAPPED.Definition: took and kept as a prisoner by force

EXAGGERATED.Definition: made to seem bigger or more important than they were

PURSUING.Definition: trying to achieve or get it

TASKED WITH.Definition: given (a job or duty) to do

PROSECUTED.Definition: officially accused of it in court

MIX-UP.Definition: a mistake or confusion between things

OVERCHARGING.Definition: asking for more money than was fair or correct

NEATLY.Definition: in a tidy or organised way

TIDILY.Definition: in a clean and orderly way

SIPHONED OFF.Definition: secretly taken from a larger amount

INTERMEDIARIES.Definition: people who helped communicate or make deals between others

BRIEFED.Definition: given the main information about it

NODDED AT.Definition: moved his head to show he agreed or understood

SIGNED OFF ON.Definition: approved or agreed to them officially

LEANING ON.Definition: depending on or using it for support

THE OTHER SHOE DROPPED.Definition: the next bad event happened, as expected

SCOOP.Definition: a special news story before anyone else had it

ROUTED.Definition: sent along a particular path or route

SMELLED BLOOD.Definition: sensed weakness or vulnerability in the situation

SHREDDED.Definition: cut or torn into very small pieces

TONE.Definition: the sound or feeling in his voice

DEFIANTLY.Definition: in a bold way that showed resistance

PATRIOTIC.Definition: showing love and support for his country

BUMPER STICKERS.Definition: small signs stuck on car bumpers (protective bars) with short messages

ON APPEAL.Definition: after asking a higher court to change the decision

HYPOCRITICAL.Definition: pretending to have good beliefs while doing the opposite

GONE OUT OF FASHION.Definition: been no longer popular or common

SWORN ENEMIES.Definition: countries that completely hate each other

GUERRILLAS.Definition: members of small groups fighting a larger army
